image.altText: Police block roads on a deserted street at night

props.synopsis: Premier Roger Cook says a letter was sent to WA's education minister with concerns about the behaviour of the teen, who was a student at Rossmoyne Senior High School, where parents are expressing shock about the incident.

title.children: 'I have no words': Parents express shock after Perth high school student is shot dead by police

image.altText: Callum and Jake smiling and holding a dog.

props.synopsis: Mexican authorities say they believe two Australian tourists and their American friend were shot dead by thieves who were trying to steal their car for its tyres.

title.children: 'Wanted to steal their tyres': Aussie brothers confirmed dead in what Mexican police say was botched robbery

image.altText: A composite image of three men, all looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Russia's policy of encouraging convicts to bolster its invasion of Ukraine was simple — survive six months and get your freedom. Some returned to the communities they once terrorised, only to commit new crimes.

title.children: Putin told killers and cannibals to 'atone for their crime on the battlefield'. It didn't end well

image.altText: A mum stands with her six young children outside a brown brick building near a wire-mesh door and window, in daylight.

props.synopsis: A farmer's offer of a place to settle in return for work came as a huge relief to a mother of six after a desperate search for housing — until his demands escalated. Advocates worry more property owners are taking advantage of vulnerable people.

title.children: Homeless family says farmer exploited them for labour after 4,000km cross-country journey

image.altText: Qantas plane on the runway at Brisbane airport

props.synopsis: Qantas reaches a $120 million agreement with the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission to settle a lawsuit against the airline for selling seats on flights that had already been cancelled.

title.children: 'Egregious and unacceptable': Qantas agrees to $120 million settlement for selling tickets on cancelled flights

image.altText: A cruise ship from above surrounded by choppy seas.

props.synopsis: A body has been found as part of a search for a man missing off a cruise ship near Sydney.

title.children: Body found in major search for passenger missing from cruise ship near Sydney

image.altText: koala pic thumbnail

props.synopsis: They have a reputation for being lazy and sleeping all day, but this koala made a surprise entry in this year's Ironman Australia triathlon at Port Macquarie.

title.children: Koala 'on a mission' surprises athletes in Ironman Australia triathlon

image.altText: Yarra Valley Grammar School sign

props.synopsis: Three male students at Yarra Valley Grammar are suspended after staff discovered a spreadsheet where the students used highly offensive terms to rate female pupils.

title.children: 'Shocked and outraged': Melbourne private school says it's contacted police over ranking of female students

image.altText: Carmel Rugolino with her ex-husband and two sons celebrating a birthday

props.synopsis: Carmel was readying to begin her journey to motherhood alone, but a phone call while on a lunch break with a colleague changed that.

title.children: I asked my coworker to be my sperm donor. Then we fell in love

image.altText: A wide shots of dozens of sea lions crowding docks at pier 39.

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 sea lions can be seen at San Francisco's Pier 39 — a number not seen at that spot since 1989.

title.children: Anchovy feast draws scores of sea lions to famous San Francisco pier

image.altText: A Colombian soccer player walking into court with his lawyer.

props.synopsis: Colombian player Angel Torres has fronted Gosford Local Court charged with aggravated sexual assault, sexual intercourse without consent, and intimidation.

title.children: A-League star winger faces court over alleged sexual assault

image.altText: Dirty money image

props.synopsis: Buying a home? Soon you won't have as much competition from drug dealers, corrupt officials and criminals with dirty money thanks to new laws and a boost to enforcement.

title.children: Australian homes have been 'a very attractive destination for dirty money', but that's about to change

image.altText: Blonde woman holds eye iPad to her face. The iPad screen shows the covered side of her face as a glam photograph

props.synopsis: Chelsea Bonner has been fighting to change unrealistic perceptions of beauty for decades. Now she's taking on her biggest foe yet – artificial intelligence.

title.children: Meet the woman taking on AI, its 'fake' models and alarming beauty standards

image.altText: Composite of a blurry image of a man with a beard and a man sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: ACT police say the human remains found near Point Hut Crossing in Canberra’s south on Sunday are likely those of missing Canberra man Tim Lyons.

title.children: Human remains found near Point Hut Crossing likely those of missing Canberra man Tim Lyons, police say

image.altText: A side-by-side image shows David McBride in pale blue linen shirt and Richard Boyle in suit and patterned tie

props.synopsis: Governments like to be seen to be supporters of whistleblowers, but when it comes to the crunch, perception and reality are two different things and tough talk often becomes hostage to excruciating long delays or watered-down reforms, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Real Australians understand the value of whistleblowers, but when it comes to the crunch, our leaders are slow on reform

image.altText: A close up looking over the shoulder of a woman using her mobile phone on the platform of the train station.

props.synopsis: The telco will postpone the closure of the 20-year-old network until August 31 to give Australians more time to upgrade their handsets amid concerns about access to emergency services.

title.children: Telstra delays 3G network shutdown amid concerns about access to emergency calls

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The federal government estimates student debts will be indexed at 4 per cent, but that figure is not set in stone just yet.

title.children: The government wants to change how HECS debts are indexed. So what's the new rate?

image.altText: Signage on a store window reading "OPTUS YES"

props.synopsis: The ASX is trading higher after very strong gains on Wall Street after "Goldilocks" jobs numbers on Friday. Qantas is set to pay a $100 million penalty and $20 million in fines for selling tickets on flights that had already been cancelled. Follow live.

title.children: Optus names new CEO, Qantas agrees to $120 million 'ghost flights' settlement, ASX higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX makes solid gains at midday
Optus names NBN boss Stephen Rue as new CEO

image.altText: A nurse prepares for surgery wearing blue scrubs and a surgical mask and pulling on a pair of gloves in an operating theatre.

props.synopsis: Thousands of patients caught COVID in Victorian public hospitals in the past two years and hundreds died, fuelling concerns that health services aren't taking strong enough precautions against airborne viruses.

title.children: Hundreds of patients died after catching COVID in hospital, and experts say their deaths were preventable

image.altText: Antony Loewenstein sits at his desk by his computer and looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Antony Loewenstein's investigations on Israel have earned him acclaim around the world, but within his own community, he has been labelled a traitor.

title.children: How Jewish author Antony Loewenstein changed his mind about Israel and became a voice against the Gaza war

image.altText: Two people inside a denim-covered egg-like shell one wearing shorts, socks and sandals, the other in jeans

props.synopsis: The 2024 Eurovision Song Contest's opening ceremony was held in Sweden over the weekend, which gave us some theatrical red carpet moments.

title.children: Eurovision's version of a red carpet event had a four-legged denim egg

image.altText: a pregnant Indigenous woman stands among trees

props.synopsis: Midwives from Aboriginal Women's health centre Waminda will now be allowed to help First Nations women like Emma Ardler give birth at Shoalhaven Hospital after previous restrictions were lifted.

title.children: Aboriginal-led midwifery practice reclaims birthing rights for First Nations women

image.altText: A teacher and nursing student in a prac hospital room.

props.synopsis: The government announces a new $319 weekly practical payment to ease the financial strain of unpaid student placements.

title.children: Budget relief for nursing and teaching students hit by 'placement poverty'

image.altText: A view looking towards suburban housing from a golf course fairway.

props.synopsis: Adrienne and Glenn Pearson joined about 700 neighbours for a court showdown against a housing development on an abandoned golf course, but now the Queensland government has stepped in.

title.children: This empty golf course could be 'called in' to increase housing supply. Experts say it might be wishful thinking

image.altText: A blond-haired older man in impressive medieval armour rides a white horse through between soldiers with spears.

props.synopsis: The British actor is best known for playing a ship's captain in Titanic and a king in the Lord of the Rings films that won a combined 22 Oscars.

title.children: Bernard Hill, known for roles in The Lord of the Rings and Titanic, dies aged 79

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli of the Bulldogs leads Bulldogs players off the field

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs sit 11th on the AFL ladder with three wins and five losses following a shock seven-point loss to Hawthorn at Docklands Stadium on Sunday.

title.children: 'Too early to panic': Western Bulldogs president says no need for rash decisions despite poor performances

image.altText: Commentator Phil Gould in a suit, with a microphone, doing a broadcast for television

props.synopsis: Phil Gould says he will consult his lawyer and challenge his $20,000 fine for making "destructive" on-air comments about the NRL.

title.children: 'I've done nothing wrong': Phil Gould to fight $20k NRL fine

image.altText: A woman wearing high-visibilty clothing stands on the deck of a ship with a marine listening device in her hands.

props.synopsis: Scientists have undertaken seven voyages totalling more than 100,000 kilometres and eight months at sea to build the most up-to-date snapshot of Antarctic blue whale distribution.

title.children: Antarctic blue whales are the largest animals on the planet but tricky to find

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt and a man in a short-sleeve blue button-down shirt stand in a kitchen together.

props.synopsis: In the midst of national domestic violence and housing crises, one service is looking to landlords to help solve both.

title.children: Could landlords help solve bottlenecks in family and domestic violence support? This service thinks so

image.altText: Jim Chalmers pulls a face at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Next week's federal budget will once again collect more in tax than expected, raking in an extra $25 billion over the five-year budget forecasting period.

title.children: Federal budget to haul in extra cash once again, but less than in previous years

image.altText: The silhouette of a person jumping in front of a multi-coloured sunset

props.synopsis: Voting opened on May 6 in this year's Classic 100: Feel Good to discover the music that makes Australians feel on top of the world.

title.children: What classical or screen music makes you feel good? We're on a mission to find out with the Classic 100 poll

image.altText: A composite image of a man drawing a wombat on a wall, and a drawing three women soccer players.

props.synopsis: When Jimmi Buscombe created Gutsy the wombat under a Warrnambool bridge six years ago, he could never have imagined where it would lead him.

title.children: From marsupials to Matildas, how a viral wombat mural changed an ex-chef's life
